alert.note: Alert for Monroe Lower Keys (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Key West (Key West - The Florida Keys)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 13 at 8:31AM EST by NWS Key West
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Lower Keys in Monroe County through 900 AM EST... At 830 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Saddlebunch Keys, or near Big Coppitt Key, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Summerland Key, Upper Sugarloaf Key, Saddlebunch Keys, Bay Point, Cudjoe Key and Sugarloaf Key. This includes US 1 between mile markers 13 and 25. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
